title: MiMi Mei Fair’s ‘Hokkien’ noodles
description: These noodles are a celebration dish worth making. Whether you’re cooking up a feast for Chinese New Year or simply a Friday night, Peter Ho of London restaurant MiMi Mei Fair has created a next-level Hokkien noodle dish. The delicate balance of fish sauce, Chinese chicken powder and ground white pepper makes for an umami sensation that’ll have you coming back for seconds.
ingredients: 2 sustainable scallops, sliced in half horizontally (defrosted if needs be)
3 sustainable raw king prawns, sliced in half horizontally (defrosted if needs be)
100g yellow egg noodles, cooked (or use straight-to-wok noodles)
100g rice vermicelli noodles, cooked (or use straight-to-wok noodles)
1 tsp chicken powder (eg chicken stock cube or bouillon or see Tips)

method.Step 1: In a small bowl mix together the seasoning ingredients, then set aside. Season the scallops and prawns with pinch each of salt, sugar and corn flour, lightly sear on both sides in a wok/frying pan in a little oil, then set aside with the seasoning mix until later.

method.Step 2: Add a splash more oil to the wok/frying pan, add the noodles and vermicelli, then stir-fry, tossing over a medium heat for 1 minute.

method.Step 3: Push the noodles to one side of the wok, pour in a little more oil, then stir-fry the chopped garlic for 30 seconds. Pour in the eggs and gently mix with the garlic and noodles, add the chicken stock and seasoning mix, then simmer for 2 minutes on a low heat.

method.Step 4: Add the chives and bean sprouts along with the seared scallops and prawns. Simmer for another 1 minute, gently mixing everything together whilst it’s cooking. Once ready, squeeze over the fresh lime juice and serve straight away.
